text: just to note when I dropped in on the droga5/AT meeting this afternoon, I said that we've reduced audio spectrum data points to 200 always and start sampling from the middle of the buffer (dropping unneeded low-frequency data). The creative coder who wrote the droga5 demo said that she used a library to capture and interpret the audio data, and she's going to look into it and chat with AT to confirm how it should be handled. If we need to change anything in how we present data from the native side, they'll let us know.
maybe AT should learn some DSP
IDK, I can't cast too much shade on creative folks for wanting data to create a cool visualization, but not knowing what that data should look like
It's fun to start learning the basics, even if I can't explore it in great depth for this project
Not really casting shade on this one
I meant it truly as “please be more specific so we can do something about it”
